intro: Coffea chamissonis, commonly known as the Chamisson's coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds used for coffee. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
